message.content:
cs.AI, cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.CV, cs.RO. 

The paper focuses on training an agent to follow natural language instructions and navigate to a target object in a virtual environment using visual information. This involves multi-modal fusion of visual and textual modalities, attention mechanisms, and end-to-end training. Therefore, the most likely sub-categories are cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) and cs.CL (Computation and Language). The paper also discusses the semantic meaning of the learnt textual representations, which suggests relevance to cs.LG (Machine Learning). Additionally, the use of visual information and navigation in a virtual environment suggests relevance to cs.CV (Computer Vision) and cs.RO (Robotics).
